text:
There's a problem in the latest 2 versions of Apache servers (That I checked
in... 2.0.53 & 2.0.54). When setting VirtualHosts, the main server's
DocumentRoot is changed to whatever directory I used in the first VirtualServer.
The same is with all other VirtualServers. They get the DocumentRoot from the
first VirtualServer. When erasing or commenting all virtual servers, the
DocumentRoot of the main server returns to the one it should be... Currently I'm
trying to use different options. I even tried to set a virtual server after just
installing Apache, and not changing all the other options in httpd.conf. Nothing
helps.
creator: gregory.shutdown@gmail.com
trawick@apache.org
text:
Virtual host matching is not working as you expected.  Check the docs at 

http://httpd.apache.org/docs-2.0/vhosts/

Use a user-support list/newsgroup if that doesn't resolve it.

http://httpd.apache.org/lists.html#http-users

creator: gregory.shutdown@gmail.com
text:
I already read tons of documentations. Inserted all the example from there...
Used different modules... Nothing helped.
I've just found Apache 2.0.44 in my archives. Took the original httpd.conf, and
uncommented the example of the VirtualHost from there. Then added the host to
hosts file in windows... It didn't help! I got th esame situation!

That's because you are seeing documented and expected behavior.  See the big box
stating "Main host goes away" on
http://httpd.apache.org/docs-2.0/vhosts/name-based.html
plus the paragraph starting "Now when a request arrives..." further down the page.

As you've been told, the place for further discussion is the users list.
creator: slive@apache.org
